intro: Sisymbrium subhastatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and pinnately divided leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in the summer months. The plant is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in agricultural fields.
